Text: Thanx for the upload, but... unfortunately, I couldn't ever play either HDD or MKV files...
MKV and other HD Movies play fine here (Windows 7). :)

I've got Windows 7 Ultimate x 64 build 6.1.7600 AIO installed, updated K-Lite Codek Pack pre-installed. Now I cleaned up the system and registry, and then tried to re-install this version once more. No result. What's my fault?
I'd like to say more exactly: I can't play files from my hard disk drives...
Try this: Click on the "Select source" button and select "Open media files", select your movies directory, double click on a movie to add it to the playlist and klick on OK to play.
